humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of "疒", "皮", the original meaning is sleepiness and fatigue. "Shuowen": "Lao Ye. From the fury, the skin sound." "Zhuangzi-Heavenly Way": "One heart is determined and the world is king... its soul is not tired."

" Tired " can mean weakness. "Sun Tzu-Military Struggle": "Those who are strong come first, and those who are tired come later."

" Tired " also means poverty and hardship. One of Tang Dufu's "Shang Chun": "Xijing is exhausted for hundreds of battles, and Beique is the host of the gang."

" Tired " also means decline and withering. Tang Dufu "Xingci Zhaoling Mausoleum": "The old vulgar is the weak master, and the heroes ask the independent husband." Qiu Zhaoao's note: "Fatigue, withered."

" Tired " also means to stop. Jin Daoan's "Preface to Yin Po Sha": "Yu Xin Qin Tu, suddenly there is this sutra... I play and chant, but I can't get tired, so I read the school."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of "疒" and "皮", the original meaning is sleepiness and fatigue.
humanum_full_description:
從「疒」，「皮」聲，本義為困倦、疲乏。《說文》：「勞也。从疒，皮聲。」《莊子‧天道》：「一心定而王天下……其魂不疲。」

　　「疲」可表示衰弱。《孫子‧軍爭》：「勁者先，疲者後。」

　　「疲」也表示窮乏困苦。唐杜甫〈傷春〉之一：「西京疲百戰，北闕任群凶。」

　　「疲」還表示衰敗、凋敝。唐杜甫〈行次昭陵〉：「舊俗疲庸主，群雄問獨夫。」仇兆鰲注：「疲，凋敝。」

　　「疲」亦表示停止。晉道安〈鞞婆沙序〉：「余欣秦土，忽有此經……載玩載詠，欲疲不能，遂佐對校。」
